author: Special Correspondent
text:
The city and district police detained 228 persons under the Goondas Act in 2015.

While Tirunelveli City Police, having eight police stations, detained 77 persons, Tirunelveli District Police detained 151 persons in a bid to prevent criminal activities.

Those who are involved in heinous crimes and undermining tranquillity of society are being nabbed and detained under the Goondas Act.

After a study done by Thazhaiyoothu Deputy Superintendent of Police Rajaram on ‘contract killers’ from the district operating in various parts of Tamil Nadu revealed how the unemployed youths of a small Dalit village are being exploited by people from other districts, the ‘kingpins’ of the village were detained under the Goondas Act.

“When we opposed repeated detentions of a few youths from this village under the Goondas Act, Mr. Rajaram justified his act with concrete evidence that proved the involvement of the youths from this village in various criminal activities in various parts of the State. We had to withdraw our argument when the DSP’s explanations justified his act,” a CPI (M) activist said.

Superintendent of Police V. Vikraman has brought the ‘Goondas Section’ under his direct supervision, and prepared a comprehensive database on the criminals and their activities in and outside Tirunelveli district.
title: 228 detained under Goondas Act
